wikipedia_page.main: Lieutenant Sir William Earle Welby, 2nd Baronet (14 November 1768 – 3 November 1852) was a British land-owner, baronet and Member of Parliament for Grantham from 1807 to 1820. He also served as High Sheriff of Lincolnshire from 1823 to 1824.

response: Glynne Earle Welby was born on 26 June 1806, the eldest son of Sir William Welby, 2nd Baronet, of Denton, near Grantham, and his wife, Wilhelmina, daughter of William Spry, who was Governor of Barbados from 1767 to 1772.Casey and Salmon 2009 The family claimed descent from land-owners who came over with the Norman Conquest, but their origins have only been traced with certainty to John Welby, a subsidy collector at Denton in 1523; one of his descendants bought the manor in 1648 and occupied the manor house.Mosley 2003, p. 4009 His great grandson, William, was created a baronet and represented Grantham in Parliament (1802–06),Port 1986 while his son, the 2nd baronet, occupied the same seat for 13 years between 1807 and 1820.Port and Thorne 1986 Glynne Welby was educated at Rugby School and Oriel College, Oxford, where he matriculated in 1824.Fisher 2009Foster, p. 1520 He succeeded his father as baronet on 3 November 1852 and took additional surname of Gregory by royal licence on 5 July 1861 to comply with the will of Gregory Gregory of Harlaxton.Fisher 2009
